item.title: A resolution designating March 22, 2014, as "National Rehabilitation Counselors Appreciation Day".
A resolution designating March 22, 2014, as "National Rehabilitation Counselors Appreciation Day".

item.name: Introduced in Senate
item.text:
Designates March 22, 2014, as National Rehabilitation Counselors Appreciation Day.

Commends rehabilitation counselors and professional organizations assisting those who require rehabilitation.

item.name: Passed Senate without amendment
item.text:
(This measure has not been amended since it was introduced. The summary of that version is repeated here.)

Designates March 22, 2014, as National Rehabilitation Counselors Appreciation Day.

Commends rehabilitation counselors and professional organizations assisting those who require rehabilitation.

item.name: Social work, volunteer service, charitable organizations

item.text: Submitted in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent. (consideration: CR S1669; text as passed Senate: CR S1663)
Passed/agreed to in Senate: Submitted in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent.(consideration: CR S1669; text as passed Senate: CR S1663)

bill.title: A resolution designating March 22, 2014, as "National Rehabilitation Counselors Appreciation Day".

latestAction.text: Submitted in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent. (consideration: CR S1669; text as passed Senate: CR S1663)

item.latestTitle: A resolution commending rehabilitation counselors and supporting the goals and ideals of National Rehabilitation Counselors Appreciation Day.

latestAction.text: Submitted in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent. (consideration: CR S2904; text as passed Senate: CR S2902)

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
